Fantasy Island offers fantasies to its guests, including the Weavers. However, when a drug cartel takes the Weavers hostage, Fantasy Island becomes a living nightmare for them.

In Gwen's fantasy, she tries to save Nick from a fire that ultimately leads to his death. Later, when she is forced to relive this nightmare, she attempts to rescue him again but fails and is saved by Roarke.
Patrick recognizes Lieutenant Sullivan as his father in the military platoon that captures him. This reveals a previously unknown relationship between the two.
Melanie and Sloane are both kidnapped and brought to Fantasy Island against their wills. They form a relationship as they try to escape together.
Damon is hired by Roarke to see his deceased daughter again, but the fantasy becomes a nightmare that traps him on the island. This highlights the potential consequences of fulfilling fantasies.
Roarke's own fantasy is to be with his deceased wife, and he insists that the guests' fantasies be fulfilled to continue this one. This reveals a significant aspect of his character.
Gwen wakes up to find she has a daughter with Allen, which dissatisfies her as she realizes that it wasn't the fantasy she wanted.
The fantasies are created by spring water under a glowing rock in a cave, as revealed by Damon.

Melanie finds out that the other guests, except Melanie, are also there and attempts to save Nick, but fails and is rescued by Roarke's assistant, Julia. Nick asks Melanie out that night and she turns him down, which is the reason he was in the apartment.
Melanie takes Sloane hostage as her revenge for Nick's death and reveals that it is her true fantasy.
Julia is revealed to be Roarke's wife, brought back by the power of the island dying of a terminal illness.
Sullivan's soldiers are summoned to rescue The Weavers, but they get attacked by the zombified cartel.
J. D. Is a part of Sullivan's soldiers and gets fatally shot in the ensuing gunfight.
Sullivan sacrifices himself so Patrick and Brax can escape during the gunfight.
The remaining guests regroup at the resort but are cornered by Roarke, who reveals that they are in a fantasy in which they are all killed.
Damon's associates send a plane to rescue the guests, but it is shot down.
The guests run to the cave to destroy the glowing rock with a grenade Patrick is carrying.
Julia is revealed to be Roarke's wife, brought back by the power of the island dying of a terminal disease she was suffering from when she met Roarke.
Sloane remembers the spring water she collected before and wishes Melanie 'to be' forever with Nick. As a result, a zombified Nick attacks Melanie and drags her into the water.

The guests on Fantasy Island were convinced that Melanie's soulmate, who she had a date with, was her 'soulmate'. However, as the fantasy concludes, Julia is revealed to be Roarke's wife, brought back by the power of the island dying of a terminal disease she was suffering from when she met Roarke.
As the fantasy concludes, Gwen, Sloane, and Brax wake up at the resort, where Roarke agrees to let them go. While the guests board a plane to leave the now-purified Fantasy Island.

After Gwen, Sloane, and a resurrected J. D. depart, Roarke asks Brax to become his new assistant. Remembering a nickname J. D. gave him, Brax chooses to rename himself 'Tattoo', initiating the events of the 1977 television series.
Patrick sacrifices himself and falls on it to protect the others, paying homage to how his father died years ago: protecting his troop in Venezuela by falling onto a grenade.

In July 2018, it was announced that a horror film adaptation of the Fantasy Island television series was being developed at Blumhouse Productions and Sony Pictures. It was described as 'a mix of Westworld and The Cabin in the Woods'.
It was described as 'a mix of Westworld and The Cabin in the Woods'.

Fantasy Island earned $49 million worldwide in its box office run against a production budget of $7 million.
In the United States and Canada, Fantasy Island grossed $21.6 million in its opening weekend alongside other releases.
Fantasy Island received an approval rating of 8% on Rotten Tomatoes based on 113 critics' reviews.

node_2: fantasy island tries to show audiences the dark side of wish fulfillment, but mainly serves as a cautionary tale about the dangers of exhuming long-dead franchises.
edge: This is the statement that summarizes the critics' consensus on Fantasy Island as reviewed by Rotten Tomatoes.
Fantasy Island received a score of 22 out of 100 on Metacritic based on 29 critics' reviews.
Fantasy Island received an average grade of 'C-' from audiences polled by CinemaScore on an A+ to F scale.
